casebody.data:
Melvin JACKSON, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Appellee. No. 17807. United States Court of Appeals District of Columbia Circuit. Argued Nov. 18, 1963. Decided Dec. 12, 1963. Petition for Rehearing en Banc Denied May 25, 1964. Mr. Forbes W. Blair, Washington, D. C. (appointed by this court), for appellant. Mr. John A. Terry, Asst. U. S. Atty., with whom Messrs. David C. Acheson, U. S. Atty., Frank Q. Nebeker and William H. Collins, Jr., Asst. U. S. Attys., were on the brief, for appellee.

Before Fahy, Washington and Wright, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

This is an appeal from a conviction of second degree murder. Able court-appointed counsel urges a number of contentions, which we have carefully considered. But we find no error affecting substantial rights. The judgment of the District Court will be

Affirmed.

Circuit Judge WRIGHT took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
